info.headline: Typhoon Watch issued May 22 at 8:56AM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TYPHOON MAWAR MOVING NORTH-NORTHWEST TOWARDS THE MARIANAS... .NEW INFORMATION... The Tropical Storm Warning has been cancelled for Ulul and Polowat in Chuuk State. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides important information and recommended actions for people in Guam and the Northern Marianas. This also includes Ulul and Polowat in western Chuuk State and Satawal in eastern Yap State and surrounding islands. .Watches/Warnings... A Tropical Storm Warning remains in effect for Satawal in eastern Yap State. A Typhoon Watch continues for the following locations, Guam, Rota, Tinian, and Saipan. A Flood Watch is in effect for Guam and the Northern Marianas. Please listen closely for any Flood Warnings that might be in effect for your area. Please check the latest public and marine forecasts for detailed information about additional hazards. .STORM INFORMATION... At 7 AM ChST...the center of Typhoon Mawar (02W) was located near latitude 8.8N...longitude 148.0E. This was about 390 miles southeast of Guam. Storm motion was NNW, and intensity was 85 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... When making decisions...do not focus on the exact forecast track. TY Mawar (02W) continues to strengthen over the northern FSM and is moving slowly north-northwest. It is too early to provide exact wind and surge forecast values for specific locations in the Marianas. A general concern should be for the possibility of at least extensive damage somewhere within Mariana Islands. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... For those under a warning, preparations according to your typhoon disaster plan should be well under way or complete. Remain in shelter until the all clear is given by your local emergency management authority. For those under a watch, now is the time to begin preparing your home or business according to your typhoon disaster plan. Listen for possible warnings and be ready to evacuate if necessary. Heed the advice of local officials and comply with any orders that are issued. For interests at ports, docks and marinas, it is recommended that you perform the prescribed preparations according to your emergency operations plan for tropical cyclones. If you live on a boat, begin to safely secure your craft and make plans to leave it for adequate land-based shelter. Listen for possible warnings. Regarding the coastal waters under a watch, small craft should return to port or seek safe harbor. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. For additional precautionary and preparedness information, please refer to the detailed recommendations relative to your location as further described by your local National Weather Service office and your local emergency management. && .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 3 PM...or sooner if conditions warrant. ...Typhoon Watch remains in effect... ...New Information... Typhoon Mawar (02W) continues to strengthen. ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Stay calm and keep informed. Comply with any evacuation orders that are issued for your area. If your home is vulnerable to high winds, or you live in a surge zone or any location prone to flooding, evacuate to a designated shelter or ride out the storm in the sturdy home of family or friends. Items to bring to a shelter include a first aid kit, medicines and prescriptions, baby food and diapers, games and books, toiletries, a battery powered radio, a cell phone, flashlights with extra batteries, a blanket or sleeping bag for each person, personal identification, copies of key papers such as insurance policies, available cash and credit cards. Remember, pets are not allowed in most public shelters, so check ahead with your intended shelter. Regarding your home or business, cover all windows and doors with shutters or plywood. Move patio furniture and other loose objects indoors. Brace all exterior doors, including garage doors. Do this as early as possible. If you need to make a trip to the hardware store, the grocery store, or the gas station, do so as early as possible. && ...Probability of tropical storm/typhoon conditions... The onset of tropical storm conditions could start as early as Tuesday morning, and most likely Tuesday evening. The onset of typhoon conditions could start as early as Tuesday night. ...Winds... As Typhoon Mawar moves closer, the threat for sustained high winds is likely to increase. The latest forecast is for tropical storm force winds from Tuesday evening to Thursday afternoon. Tropical storm force winds are currently forecast to begin affecting the area early Tuesday evening. Strong Tropical Storm or Typhoon force winds are possible Tuesday night through Wednesday night. A general concern should be for the possibility of at least destructive winds somewhere across the Marianas. ...Storm surge and storm tide... Dangerous surf conditions are possible Monday night through at least Thursday night. Additional details on surf and possible inundation will be added later as the exact track and intensity information are refined. ...Inland flooding... A Flood Watch is in effect for the entire area. See latest forecast for latest information. Listen for possible flood warnings for your location...and be ready to act if flooding rains occur. Heavy rainfall is likely to develop late tonight through the next few days. Rainfall amounts of 9 to 15 inches are possible with locally heavier amounts. Monitor conditions for possible flood advisories or warnings.
